definition: along/to follow (a line, tradition etc)/to carry on/to trim (a border with braid, tape etc)/border/edge
(old) to burn paper money as an offering
drumming on a bowl in grief (idiom, refers to Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子 grieving for his lost wife)/fig. grief for a lost wife
variant of 夥頤|夥颐[huo3 yi2]
sage Emperors Shun and Yao rule every day (idiom); all for the best in the best of all possible worlds
list of emperors and kings/dynastic genealogy
wicker door, hole window (idiom); fig. wretched hovel/living in poverty
anecdote (about historical person)/lost or apocryphal story
to become accustomed to sth through long practice
to compete to produce extravagant literary works (idiom)
lit. to have only nine meals in thirty days (idiom)/fig. (of a family) on the brink of starvation/in dire straits
lit. the eye cannot bear to see it (idiom); a scene too pitiful to behold
to carry out gymnastic tricks on horizontal bar
